summary: An FBI intake document recording a call to the FBI National Threat Operations Center on October 9, 2020. The caller provides information about attending a party on Palm Beach Island, Florida, around Christmas 2000, which they believed was hosted by Jeffrey Epstein. The caller describes interactions with Lisa Villeneuve (also known as Ghislaine Lisa Villeneuve), Bobby Cox, and Curt Schmidt, and mentions an invitation to a party at Mar-a-Lago by Donald Trump.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI case for child sex trafficking; the party described by the caller is believed to have been at his house.

persons.name: Lisa Villeneuve
persons.context: Also goes by Ghislaine Lisa Villeneuve; a real estate agent in Irving, California. She was the caller's former hospital roommate and invited the caller to the Epstein party in 2000. She acted as a guide and intermediary at the party.

persons.name: Bobby Cox
persons.context: A young man introduced as a model scout at the party; Lisa Villeneuve laughed and called him a 'pimp.' He accompanied Villeneuve and the caller to the party.

persons.name: Curt Schmidt
persons.context: Met by the caller and Villeneuve at the party. He asked Villeneuve if the caller was 'cool,' which was clarified to mean either ready for sex or for cocaine.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Believed by the caller to have been the hostess of the party inside the house.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as having invited everyone at the Epstein party to a party at Mar-a-Lago.

connections.description: Villeneuve invited the caller to a party believed to be at Epstein's house and acted as an intermediary with the hostess, suggesting social familiarity with Epstein's circle.
Villeneuve introduced Cox to the caller and mocked his introduction as a model scout by calling him a 'pimp,' indicating a prior, familiar relationship.
Villeneuve took the caller to meet Schmidt at the party, and they had a conversation about the caller's suitability for sex or drugs, indicating Villeneuve and Schmidt were acquainted.
Trump's name was invoked at the Epstein party with an invitation to Mar-a-Lago, suggesting a social connection between the two men's circles.
Villeneuve went inside the party to speak with the hostess, believed to be Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating she had access to or a relationship with the event's organizer.

events.title: Epstein Christmas Party in Palm Beach
events.description: A party around Christmas time in 2000 on Palm Beach Island, FL, believed to be at Jeffrey Epstein's house. The caller was invited by Lisa Villeneuve and attended with Villeneuve and Bobby Cox. The event involved meetings with Curt Schmidt and a mention of an invitation to Mar-a-Lago by Donald Trump. Villeneuve described it as a party 'for prostitutes.'

events.title: FBI NTOC Call Reporting Epstein Party
events.description: On October 9, 2020, a caller contacted the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information about a Jeffrey Epstein party they attended in 2000. This intake was documented as part of case SOD-NY-3027571.

keyFacts: A witness reported attending a party around Christmas 2000 on Palm Beach Island that they believed was hosted by Jeffrey Epstein.
Lisa Villeneuve (also known as Ghislaine Lisa Villeneuve), a real estate agent, invited the witness and described the event as a party 'for prostitutes.'
At the party, Bobby Cox was introduced as a model scout but was called a 'pimp' by Villeneuve, and Curt Schmidt (CEO of Blue Buffalo) inquired if the witness was 'cool' for sex or cocaine.
It was announced at the party that Donald Trump had invited everyone to a party at Mar-a-Lago.
This information was reported to the FBI's National Threat Operations Center on October 9, 2020, and documented as part of the ongoing Epstein child sex trafficking investigation.
